result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. BUNDY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the sentence presently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with the victims, S.G. and S.R.G.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18.

No access to the internet.

Defendant shall surrender all passwords to any/all internet games/apps

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. BUNDY

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Initial Appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.   
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $1,500.00 cash with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with any victim involved, S.R.D., DOB: 05-22-1998.   Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.   Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.   Copy filed.
